alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 24 at 12:19PM AKST until February 26 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH EARLY SAT MORNING ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Southeast winds 40 to 55 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Along the Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...From Friday evening through early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An unusual wind event is in store for this time of the year. Strong gusty winds out of the southeast are expected to develop Friday evening and continue through early Saturday morning. With the gusty southeasterly winds, this may cause some sea ice to be pushed up against the shoreline. A low pressure system is expected to move from southeast to northwest across the eastern Bering Friday through Friday night. As the low center passes by to the south, expecting an increase in southeasterly flow aimed at the Kuskokwim Delta Coast.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
